official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide the work opportunity tax credit with respect
			 to the hiring of veterans in the field of renewable energy.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Incentives for our Nation’s Veterans in Energy Sustainability Technologies
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Incentives for our Nation’s Veterans in Energy Sustainability Technologies

header.#text: Work opportunity tax credit for veterans hired in the field of renewable energy

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended to read as follows:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text:
For purposes of this subpart, an individual shall be treated a member of a targeted group if such
			 individual is a specified veteran, but qualified wages with respect to
			 such individual shall include only wages attributable to services rendered
			 in a field of renewable energy.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
of military
			 occupational specialty or skill in a field of renewable energy or with
			 respect to advanced manufacturing, machinist or welding, or engineering,

text.#text: having received a credential or certification from the

having completed a vocational degree in a field of renewable energy during the 1-year period ending
			 on the hiring date, or
having completed a LEED certification with the United States Green Building Council.

quote.#tail:
means any veteran (as defined in paragraph (3)) who is certified by the designated local agency
			 as—

text.#text: For purposes of this paragraph, the term

For purposes of this paragraph, renewable energy means resources that rely on fuel sources that
			 restore themselves over short periods of time and do not diminish,
			 including the sun, wind, moving water, organic plant and waste material,
			 and the earth’s heat.

header.#text: Certain veterans hired in the field of renewable energy

text.#text:
The amendment made by this section shall apply to individuals who begin work for the employer after
			 December 31, 2013.
